welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.p1: In the following pages, the AOSC OS Installer will guide you through...
welcome.p2: The installation process should only take a few minutes, but will require more time on slower hardware.
welcome.sr-help: Please note that Installer may use external programs that does not come with screen reader support, such as GParted, which is used for partitioning. You may want to seek assistance at those steps. Installer will notify you by announcing "Please seek help before doing so."

desktop-or-install.title: What would you like to do?
desktop-or-install.install-system-p1: Install and setup AOSC OS on your device
desktop-or-install.rescue-and-recovery-p1: Launch the rescue and recovery workspace

variant.title: Variants
variant.p1: Please select from below your desired distribution. The full Desktop distribution is suitable for most personal desktop devices.

host.title: Hostname
host.p1: Please input your desired hostname. This is otherwise known as a device name used for identification. Your hostname may only consist letters a-z, numbers 0-9, and dashes ("-").

abort.title: Abort?
abort.p1: Do you really want to abort installation? Doing so will result in an {0} AOSC OS installation in the target partition you specified.
abort.p2: Would you like to save your current installation configuration? When you return, by selecting the original installation partition, installer will restart based on your previous configuration.

finish.title: And... Done!
finish.p1: Installer has successfully installed AOSC OS on your device!
finish.p2: Please eject or unplug your installation media (usually a USB flash drive or a DVD) immediately after you click on "Reboot." Installer will then restart your device and AOSC OS will take it from here.
finish.sr-help: Please seek help before doing so, as this screen reader will stop guiding you after the installer exits. AOSC OS does not come with screen reader and other accessibility settings enabled by default, so you may need assistance setting up. Your assistant may find relevant documentations on our Wiki site.
finish.p3: Thank you for your time and for choosing AOSC OS!

swap.title: Swapfile
swap.p1: Would you like to create a swapfile? A swapfile could help when your system is under high memory load by offloading some of your program data to your storage device, thereby improving system stability.
swap.w1: Running AOSC OS without a swapfile may cause instability at high memory load, resulting in possible application crashes and data loss!
swap.l2: Installer will create a swapfile of {size} on your AOSC OS system partition.
swap.l3: Installer recommends that you create a swapfile of {size} in size.

rescue.title: RescueKit
rescue.p1: RescueKit is a rescue and restoration environment for AOSC OS. RescueKit provides tools for data backup and recovery, reinstallation, and more. Would you like to install RescueKit?
rescue.l1: Installer will create a RescueKit {size} partition within the AOSC OS system partition at {path}.
rescue.w1: Without RescueKit, you will likely need to use an external live media (like LiveKit) to repair or reinstall AOSC OS.
rescue.bad1: Installer has detected insufficient space on your storage device. RescueKit requires 5GiB of additional space in your system partition to install.
rescue.bad2: Installer has detected a non-GPT partition scheme on your storage device. RescueKit is only available for devices with a GPT partition scheme.

network.title: Network Connection
network.p1: Your device does not appear to have be connected to the Internet. AOSC OS requires Internet connectivity to download system releases.
network.p2: To connect to the Internet, select the "Configure network ..." button below, or use the close button on the top right to cancel installation.
network.r1: Waiting on you to finish configuring the network connection...

device.title: Storage Device
device.p1: Pelease select a storage device to use as your AOSC OS boot drive.
device.e1: The selected device is too small. {0}GiB is required to install AOSC OS.

part.title: Partitioning
part.p1: Please select your AOSC OS system partition. To make changes to your partitions, select the "Manage partitions..." button below.
part.p2: It seems like you have an empty or new storage device. Installer can help you create a standard partition scheme based on your storage configuration, as you press "Next," installer will partition your storage device based on the following specifications.
part.p3: If you would like to partition the storage device yourself, please select the "Manage partitions..." button below.
part.p4: Installer can help you create a standard partition scheme based on your storage configuration, as you press "Next," installer will partition your storage device based on the following specifications.
part.l2: Create a {0} AOSC OS System Partition.
part.e1: The selected partition is too small. {0}GiB is required to install AOSC OS.
part.e2: Installer does not support this filesystem. Please use ext4/xfs instead.
part.e3: The combination of {bootmode} and {table} is not supported.
part.e4: The unit does not have an EFI partition to continue the installation.
part.e5: This partitioned table type is not supported: {table}
part.r2:
Waiting on you to finish partitioning...
If you are stuck, please try and strike Alt-Tab to bring up the GParted window and close it when you are done.

esp.title: ESP Partition
esp.p1: Installer detected multiple EFI System Partitions (ESPs) on your device, which are used to store critical boot data such as the bootloader. This partition and your AOSC OS system partition should generally be on the same storage device, making it easier to migrate and backup system data when the need arises.
esp.p2: Should you decide to specify an EFI System Partition on another storage device, do think twice: if that drive is subsequently replaced, you will need to reinstall the bootloader for AOSC OS.

mirror.title: Mirror
mirror.p1: Installer will now detect the fastest mirror to download AOSC OS from. If you would like to manual select a mirror, press "Customize..." below.
mirror.p2: Listed below are all available mirrors to download AOSC OS from. You may select based on the mirrors' geographical location. Alternatively, you may benchmark them using the "Benchmark..." button.

user.title: User Account
user.p1: Please enter and confirm your desired username and password. Please note that your username must start with a lower-cased alphabetical letter (a-z), and contain only lower-cased letters a-z, numbers 0-9, and dash ("-").

confirm.title: Pre-Flight Check
confirm.p1: Installer will perform the following operations:
confirm.l2: A {size} partition will be created for RescueKit.
confirm.l3: AOSC OS {variant} will be downloaded from {mirror}.
confirm.l5: AOSC OS will use the {0} locale.
confirm.l6: Your timezone will be set to {0}.
confirm.w1: By pressing "Next," Installer will begin downloading, installing, and configuring AOSC OS on your device. If anything looks off, please use the "Previous" button to return to the previous configuration pages.

locale.title: Locale & Time
locale.p1: Please select your preferred locale. Your locale setting will affect your system's display language and other preferences.
locale.p2: Please select your local time zone. Linux systems usually use UTC as local time by default, but may result in time discrepancy with your other operating systems, like Windows. Setting RTC time as local time will prevent this.

d.eta-1: Almost finished... | Nearly finished... | {time} minutes remaining...

driver.title: NVIDIA
driver.p1: Installer has detected a graphics card on your device that is supported by NVIDIA's official Linux driver. Installing this driver may enhance overall system stability, power efficiency, and graphics performance. This driver is considered proprietary software and carries additional licensing terms in the {0}.
driver.p1-1: License For Customer Use of NVIDIA GeForce Software
driver.p2: Would you like to install a system release with official NVIDIA drivers preinstalled?
driver.l1: Installer will download and install NVIDIA's official Linux driver. By proceeding with this option, you agree to the aforementioned licensing terms.
driver.l2: Installer will proceed to install AOSC OS preinstalled with the open source Nouveau graphical stack. When used with newer NVIDIA graphics cards, you may encounter issues such as display artifacts, freezes, startup failures, and lowered performance.

slides.p1:
AOSC OS is brought to you by a group of enthusiastic maintainers who works on their free time, hoping to bring you an efficient and reliable Linux experience.
Installation should take only a few minutes, but could take longer depending on your device's performance. Please sit back and relax with our music album procured for you.
slides.p2:
Built with out-of-the-box usability and easy maintenance in mind, AOSC OS is a ready-made toolbox for your everyday computing.
From office productivity to server administration, photoediting to 3D modeling, note-taking to translation projects, AOSC OS has the right tools ready for you. With our clear and refined software repository, we will get you right under way for whatever awaits.
For Internet-restricted regions, AOSC OS is ready to help you connect with the globalized world.
slides.p3:
Powered by a solid graphical stack and strong community support, AOSC OS is ready for your entertainment needs.
Play your favorite CD with Strawberry, watch your latest block-buster movies with VLC, or share them together with friends and family with Kodi, AOSC OS has everything you need for a good time.
Play your favorite Linux and Windows® games with Steam®, fuel your nostalgia with console emulators! If you feel like a game or two, we have you covered.
slides.p4:
AOSC OS comes pre-installed with RescueKit where available, a self-contained maintenance and rescue environment.
Corrupted file system? Accidental deletes? Messed up system updates? No worries! RescueKit has most (if not everything) you need to get your AOSC OS back on track.
If you are the cautious type, RescueKit also comes with essential tools for backing up your system for a rainy day.
slides.p5:
Built on the highly scalable Linux Kernel and its portable and vibrant userspace, AOSC OS is ready for your single-board computers, laptops, desktops, and servers.
Configured for full feature sets, AOSC OS readies your new and old devices and peripherals for maximal functionality.
Proprietary drivers needed? No problem! With our liberal software support policies, if your hardware vendors let us, we will ship them for you.
slides.p6:
The operating system's principal task is to help get your applications up and running and keeping your productivity on track.
Apart from the software packages tested and shipped by yours truly, AOSC OS also supports installing applications from inter-distribution ecosystems such as Flatpak, Linyaps, and Snap, as well as distribution formats such as AppImage. Our Spiral project can also improve compatibility with applications built for Debian and Ubuntu.
slides.p7:
At AOSC, we pride ourselves with friendly and ready support for our users. Warranty and merchantability notwithstanding, we believe that our users should be respected of their time and energy spent on adapting to a new work environment.
At Telegram, Discord, IRC, or Matrix, our maintainers, contributors, and friends are ready to offer help. We wish you much joy at our community and great success with AOSC OS.
Enjoy!

error1: Internal Error: Inter-process communication was not successful: {msg}.
error2: Your system does not have the minimum required disk space available. Required: {r_size}, found: {f_size}.
error3: Dear time traveller, unfortunately, the AOSC OS installer at this timeline only supports up to 8PiB of RAM. So please try limiting the RAM available to this system if possible.
